newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR CLOSES MIXED ON UNITS ON THURSDAY.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR CLOSES MIXED ON UNITS ON THURSDAY.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar was quoted softer on the U.S. dollar and the mark but was trading firmer against sterling and the rand at the close of Thursday's interbank market, foreign exchange dealers said.
"There was a big exporter that came in this morning and the dollar appreciated as far as 11.2925/3025 against the U.S. dollar," one dealer said, adding:
"Then towards the end I think there were a couple of people who needed to cover for some payments and we went down to close at 11.3025/3125."

The local unit was also weaker on the mark at 6.6600/6670 from 6.5450/5575 but gained on sterling to 18.3120/3335 from 18.4695/4800. Against South Africa's rand it was also quoted firmer at 2.5270/5315 from 2.5400/5500.
